sentences.english: So that is my goal, to capture the fantastic details hidden in these natural wonders.
sentences.chinese: 捕捉匿藏在这些自然奇景中的奇异细节正是我的目标。

sentences.english: The first time in my life I saw a complete half-circle rainbow.
sentences.chinese: 第一次看到了传说中的霓和虹同时悬挂在天空的奇景。

sentences.english: Another phenomenon in the North when a autumn arrives is the fruit-trees.
sentences.chinese: 北方的果树，到秋来，也是一种奇景。

sentences.english: And Sun-watching Platform is the best place to enjoy wonderful sun-rising.
sentences.chinese: 峰上还有观日台，是看日出奇景的好地方。

sentences.english: The Niagara Falls is one of the natural wonders of the world.
sentences.chinese: 尼亚加拉瀑布是世界天然奇景之一。

sentences.english: This was a marvel never seen by eighty-year-old man in Dodrupchen monastery.
sentences.chinese: 这是多智钦寺八十岁的老人都从未目睹过的人间奇景。

sentences.english: Range upon range of mountains, winding water, and sea with miracles.
sentences.chinese: 山有层次，水有曲折，海有奇景。

sentences.english: The sunrise at the seaside was quite a sight to behold.
Thy eyes shall behold strange women, and thy heart shall utter perverse things.
sentences.chinese: 那时，你的眼要见到奇景，你的心要吐出狂语。

sentences.english: Jiangcheng filled winter is also a great wonders of the North.
sentences.chinese: 冬季弥漫江城，也是北国一大奇景。

sentences.english: If you are lucky, here you can see the wonderful scene of snowing in the hot summer.
sentences.chinese: 如果有幸，在这里，你还能看到盛夏落雪的奇景。

sentences.english: Though unable to see a mirage today.
sentences.chinese: 即使没能看到海市蜃楼的奇景。

definition: nothing more beautiful can be imagined (idiom)
